result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 14CF247, 15CF102 & 15CF356.  Defendant David V Mossberg in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant David V Mossberg in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:32 pm.  
14CF247-Amended Information to be filed.  Count 1-both repeaters stricken-guilty.  Count 2-Both repeaters stricken-guilty.
Counts 3/4-DRI.
15CF102-DRI.
15CF356-DRI.
SENTENCE:  
Count 1 - 6 mo PCJ, subj to WR & GT.  $265.60.  60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.  No DNA sample or surcharge.
Count 2 - 9 mo PCJ, subj to WR & GT, concurrent w/ count 1.  No DNA sample or surcharge.  
Ct finds 1 day credit.  To provide sentence credit by 7/28.  
Bond to be applied toward fines then, return remainder of bond to def c/o Peggy Herman, 10940 Crooked Lake blvd, Apt 422, Coon Rapids MN 55433.  PCR.  2:50 pm adj.
Agreement on Detainers, Notice of Untried Indictment, Information or Complaint and of Right to Request Disposition - Minnesota Department of Corrections - St. Cloud
Warrant Return- Def in custody of MCF St. Cloud. Judicial Detainer needed
